titleStmt.title: The Huntington-shire plovv-man: or, The plowmans complain for the loss of his hearts delight. True love alone, does cause my moan, such sorrows I possess; I being left of joys bereft, to languish in distress. Tune of, My child must have a father. This may be printed. R.P.

The Huntington-shire plovv-man: or, The plowmans complain for the loss of his hearts delight. True love alone, does cause my moan, such sorrows I possess; I being left of joys bereft, to languish in distress. Tune of, My child must have a father. This may be printed. R.P.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for P. Brooksby, at the Golden-Ball in Pye-Corner.,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "Young men and maids I pray attend ..."
Place and date of publication suggested by Wing.
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
